auth.logout_confirm: Are you sure you want to logout?

wizard.title: Create AI Project
wizard.description: Start a new project with AI assistance

step_desc.provider: Choose an AI assistant for the interview
step_desc.concretize: Flesh out the idea based on discussion

quick_start.title: Quick Start
quick_start.desc: Concretize ideas and generate tasks via AI chat.

import_git.title: Import from Git
import_git.desc: Select existing Git repo or AI agent folder.

idea.label: Freely describe your project idea
idea.placeholder:
Describe the app or service you want to build.
e.g., 'I want to build a travel itinerary app. It needs user authentication and maps.'

tip.title: Tip: What makes a good idea description?
tip.item1: Clearly describe the problem or goal
tip.item2: Mention any specific tech stack or platform
tip.item3: Describe target users or business context
tip.item4: Mention any reference products if applicable

idea.no_repos_desc: Use 'Select Folder' to add a repository manually

provider.guide: Select an AI model for the interview process.

no_providers.title: No Active AI Providers
no_providers.desc: To proceed with AI interview, you must configure and enable at least one AI provider in Settings > AI Providers.

progress_guide.ongoing: Answer AI's questions to flesh out your idea.
progress_guide.complete: Sufficient information collected. You can proceed to the next step.

ai_decide.label: Let AI Decide
ai_decide.desc: Delegate the best choice to AI

skip.label: Decide Later
skip.desc: Skip for now and decide later

interview.options_title: If unsure, choose an option below:
interview.input_placeholder: Type your answer or select an option...

list.empty_desc: Create your first project to get started

msg.reset_confirm:
Are you sure you want to reset project results?

This will delete:
- Project AI Memory
- All Task Results & History
- Task Statuses (Reset to Todo)

Task definitions and settings will be preserved.

info.title: Project Info
info.no_initial_prompt: No initial prompt has been set
info.project_default_ai_info: These are the project's default AI settings. Tasks will use these settings unless they specify their own AI configuration.
info.mcp_default_info: Configured MCPs are used by default for all tasks in this project. You can override this in individual task settings if needed.
info.goal_help: Describe the project goal to help AI generate more accurate results.
info.goal_placeholder: Describe the project goal and what you want to achieve...
info.guidelines_placeholder: Write AI guidelines in Markdown format...

memory.title: Project Memory
memory.curator_tip: The selected Curator automatically updates the Project Memory upon task completion.
memory.no_context_desc:
AI will automatically update the Project Memory when tasks are completed.
Set project goals, constraints, and phases to help AI agents produce more consistent results.
memory.reset_confirm_desc: All project memory (summary, decision logs, glossary) will be deleted. This action cannot be undone.
memory.info_notice: This memory is automatically updated by the AI Curator upon task completion. All AI agents share this context to perform consistent work.

detail.title: Task Detail
detail.macro_tip: üí° Tip: {{ prev }}, {{ task.N }}, {{ project.name }} etc. Supports macro autocomplete (Ctrl+Space or {{)

warning.readonly_title: Settings cannot be changed during execution
warning.readonly_desc: Please STOP the task to change settings

macro.tip: üí° Tip: Macros are replaced with actual values at runtime.

notification.test_sent: Test notification sent. Please check your webhook URL.

subdivide.desc: If this task is too large, you can subdivide it into subtasks. After subdivision, the parent task is used for grouping only and execution is disabled.
subdivide.title: Task Subdivision

group.title: Group Task
group.desc: This task is subdivided into {count} subtasks. It is used for grouping only and cannot be executed directly.

dependency.desc: Executed automatically when specified tasks are completed
dependency.advanced_desc: Set complex logic conditions. You can use ! (Not) operator for 'not completed' condition.
dependency.once_desc: Auto execute only when status is TODO
dependency.repeat_desc: Execute regardless of current status if condition met

auto_review.label: Enable Auto REVIEW
auto_review.desc: AI automatically reviews if the prompt result matches the intention
auto_review.settings_desc: Specify Provider and Model for auto review

auto_approve.label: Auto Approve
auto_approve.desc: Automatically mark as DONE upon successful execution without review
auto_approve.project_warning: This task uses Auto Approve instead of Project Auto Review
auto_approve.manual_info: Manual review required after execution completes

notification_settings.title: Notification Settings
notification_settings.desc: Receive notifications via Slack or Webhook for task execution and review events. Task settings override project settings.

suggestion.title: AI Assistant can improve your prompt

script_notice.title: Script Task
script_notice.desc: Executes your written code directly. No AI execution settings needed.

task.operator_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Operator assigned. AI settings below are disabled.

alert.config_required: Please configure notification settings first. (Slack Webhook URL or Custom Webhook URL)
alert.test_sent: Test notification sent. Please check your webhook URL.

macro_example.report_suffix: Create a report based on this date.

assistant.title: AI Assistant
assistant.subtitle: Ask me anything
assistant.welcome_message: Let me know if you need help with your project.

action_messages.summary: What did I do this week?

header.title: Settings
header.subtitle: Configure your preferences and manage your account

shortcuts.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
shortcuts.description: Customize keyboard shortcuts for common actions

show_task_ids.title: Show Task IDs
show_task_ids.description: Display task IDs in the interface

about.title: About
about.description: HighFlow is an AI Workflow management tool that helps you automate and streamline your AI-powered workflows.

default_highflow.description: HighFlow-based AI available upon login (uses app credits)

openai.description: GPT-4, GPT-4 Turbo, and GPT-3.5 models

highflow.title: ‚ú® Default HighFlow AI (Credit)
highflow.credit_usage: Uses app account credits after login
highflow.login_notice: Login prompt will appear when running tasks if not logged in.

anthropic.description: Claude 3.5, Claude 3 Opus, Sonnet, and Haiku models

google.description: Gemini Pro, Gemini Flash, and PaLM models

mcp.description: Configure Model Context Protocol servers to extend AI capabilities with external tools.

empty_state.title: No results found
empty_state.message: Try different search terms or filters

filesystem.description: Filesystem access - Read/write files, list directories

shell.description: Shell execution - Run terminal commands and scripts

git.description: Git version control - Commit, branch, view history

fetch.description: HTTP Fetch - Retrieve web pages, call REST APIs

jira.description: Atlassian Jira integration - Create, view, update issues

confluence.description: Atlassian Confluence integration - Search docs, create/edit pages

puppeteer.description: Browser Automation - Web page screenshots, scraping

playwright.description: Browser Automation - Cross-browser testing and automation

github_mcp.description: GitHub Integration - Manage repositories, issues, PRs

gitlab_mcp.description: GitLab Integration - Manage repositories, issues, MRs

slack_mcp.description: Slack - Read/Write workspace messages and automate collaboration

notion_mcp.description: Notion Integration - Manage pages and databases

google_drive.description: Google Drive Integration - Search, upload, download files

figma_mcp.description: Figma - Read files/components, comments, extract assets

framer_mcp.description: Framer - Query projects, automate frame/component variants and deployment

penpot_mcp.description: Penpot - Read and update open source design system and assets

sequential_thinking.description: Sequential Thinking - Analyze complex problems step-by-step

sentry.description: Sentry Integration - Error monitoring, issue analysis

everything.description: Local File Search (Everything) - Windows file system indexing search

brave_search.description: Brave Search - Web, local, and news search

mysql.description: MySQL Database - Query execution and schema inspection

postgres.description: PostgreSQL - Query execution and table inspection

sqlite.description: SQLite Database - Local DB file query/manipulation

kubernetes.description: Kubernetes Cluster - Inspect pods/services and logs

aws.description: AWS Cloud - Resource inspection and management (S3/EC2, etc.)

atlassian_cloud_oauth.description: Atlassian Cloud (Jira & Confluence) - Secure access via OAuth 2.0

atlassian_rovo.description: Atlassian Rovo MCP Server (Official) - Jira, Confluence, Compass integration (OAuth 2.1)

channels_read.label: List Public Channels
channels_read.description: Get a list of public channels in the workspace.

channels_history.label: Read Public Channel Messages
channels_history.description: Read conversation history in public channels.

groups_read.label: View Private Channel Info
groups_read.description: View information about private channels the bot is invited to.

groups_history.label: Read Private Channel Messages
groups_history.description: Read conversation history in private channels the bot is invited to.

mpdm_read.label: View Group DM Info
mpdm_read.description: View information about multi-person Group DMs.

mpdm_history.label: Read Group DM Messages
mpdm_history.description: Read conversation history in Group DMs.

messages_write.label: Send/Edit Messages
messages_write.description: Send and edit messages in channels, DMs, threads.

users_read.label: View User List
users_read.description: View workspace member list and profiles.

install.description: Automatically install and update required CLI tools.
install.warning_connect: Connection test only available after installation.

enable_toggle.label: Enable {name}
enable_toggle.description: Enable this MCP server for use in tasks

agents.description: Manage AI coding agents running in your local environment. These tools run in your terminal and don't require external API integration.

claude_code.description: Anthropic's official AI coding agent. Performs coding tasks via natural language in the terminal.

codex.description: OpenAI's AI coding agent. Generates and modifies code based on GPT-4.

integrations.description: Connect with Slack, Discord, Git services, and more to automate workflows and receive notifications.

webhooks.alert_fields_needed: Please fill in all required fields
webhooks.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this webhook?

export.title: Export Settings
export.description: Download your settings as a JSON file

import.title: Import Settings
import.description: Load settings from a JSON file

reset.title: Reset to Defaults
reset.description: Reset all settings to their default values
reset.confirm: Are you sure you want to reset all settings? This cannot be undone.

wizard.title: Setup Wizard
wizard.incomplete_msg: Initial setup wizard is not completed

publish.title: Publish to Marketplace
publish.drop_zone: Click to upload or drag and drop

access_control.title: Access Control
access_control.domains_hint: Users with these email domains will have access

welcome.title: Welcome to HighFlow!
welcome.subtitle: Efficiently manage projects, automate tasks, and maximize productivity with AI.
welcome.note: You can start using it right away after completing a few simple settings.

profile.intro: Please set your basic user information

ai_provider.intro: Connect multi-modal AI or local LM Studio/Ollama for image analysis and automation. Local servers are automatically detected if running.
ai_provider.no_providers: No AI providers available. Please add a new provider in Settings.

local_guide.title: LM Studio Setup Guide
local_guide.step1: Download and install latest version from lmstudio.ai
local_guide.step2: Start Server > OpenAI Compatible Server in LM Studio
local_guide.step3: Load a model and click Start Server
local_guide.step4: Verify Base URL matches the one shown in LM Studio

ai_provider.base_url_desc: Must match the address displayed in LM Studio server.

api_key.label: Connect with API Key
api_key.note: API keys are stored locally and never sent externally.

status.check_running: Please check if LM Studio is running

preferences.intro: Customize your environment to suit your work style

projects.found_desc: You can select these repositories immediately when creating a project.
projects.no_repos_desc: You can select manually later when creating a project
projects.optional_note: This step is optional. You can skip and set it up later.

complete.title: Setup Completed!
complete.subtitle: You are now ready to use AI Workflow Manager. Create a new project or import an existing repository to start.
